text:
e="preserve">Ramon Daniel Pennington (December 22, 1933 – October 7, 2020) was an American country music singer-songwriter, musician and record producer. He was known for writing the Waylon Jennings and Montgomery Gentry song "I'm a Ramblin' Man", and for founding the independent Step One Records label. He was born in Clay County, Kentucky.
Pennington died in a house fire in Hendersonville, Tennessee on October 7, 2020 at the age of 86.
